TopicTitle: [1.4.x] Real Solar System Remastered By XxLedvin25xX [Ago 19 2018]

Articles.Content:
Hello! For all visitors of this post, I'm not earning money or reward for this mod, it's just a help to the community, saying that you can continue with the post, greetings!

Real Solar System REMASTERED

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Original Mod Made By NathanKell.

Link To Orginal Mod "Real Solar System"

License: CC-BY-NC-SA

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This mod adds the real solar system to its kerbal space program, where its orbits, sizes, actual textures, real antenna sites and most real launch sites are added.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Download the Real Solar System (REMASTERED) Here from Spacedock or Here from CurseForge

Link removed for update of original creator : 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Download the textures repository of the original author mod Here (choose your resolution)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IT IS COMPLETELY COMPATIBLE WITH RSSVE-LITE

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Highly Recommended:

Real Scale Boosters

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

RSSDateTime

RemoteTech

KSCSwitcher

DistantObject

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DEPENDENCE!

- Kopernicus

- ModuleManager

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 

Hello This is a remastering of the Original Real Solar System Mod (Only Available in 1.2 and 1.3) Made by NathanKell.

=========================================================================================

Installation:

1- Download Kopernicus and ModuleManager for your game version.

2- Download The "[1.4.x] Real Solar System (REMASTERED)"

2- Drop all the contents in the folder of your KSP "Gamedata" 

3-  Download textures for Real Solar System from the original author

4- Enjoy!


=========================================================================================


License CC-BY-NC-SA

Original Mod By NathanKell

Remastered By XxLedvin25xX

 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Titan With Saturn Background.

Enceladus With Jupiter Background.

Our Planet, the earth.

And Moon.

Total In Game Images.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Changelog
V1.4
-Fixed terrain textures and add all functions of original RSS
V1.3
- The Installation Simplified
V1.2
- Launch sites and resources have been added
V1.1
- Fixed Venus textures
V1.0
- Remastered To KSP 1.4.2

Edited September 9, 2018 by XxLedvin25xX

Installation:

(Warning Follow The Steps As Mentioned Because Something Could Not Work!!)

1- Download Kopernicus for your game version

2- Download KSC Switcher (The Latest Version)

3- Download CommunityResourcePack for you game version

4- Download The "[1.4.2] V1.2 Real Solar System "

5- Download textures for Real Solar System from the original author

6- Drop and replace all the content of Real Solar System in your "Gamedata" folder

7- Enjoy!

Hi and welcome to the forums @XxLedvin25xX thanks for your efforts to update RSS to the current KSP. I have been missing it in my recent games.

Regarding installation, can I ask why this mod overwrites the Kopernicus/config/System.cfg? Why not alter the configs with a Module Manager patch?

I'm always a bit wary of changing files directly, because I will probably forget that this file needs to be over written next time Kopernicus gets an update.

 

Edited August 19, 2018 by Nightside
published too soon.

2 hours ago, Nightside said:

Hi﻿ and welcome to the forums @XxLedvin25xX thanks for your efforts to update RSS to the current KSP. I have been missing it in my recent games.

Regarding installation, can I ask why this mod overwrites the Kopernicus/config/System.cfg? Why not alter the configs with﻿ a Module Manager patch?

I'm always a bit wary of changing files directly, because I will probably forget that this file needs to be over written next time Kopernicus gets an upda﻿te.﻿

 ﻿

Hello @Nightside and thanks!

Going back to the subject I've been thinking about it that when Kopernicus is updated, we have to rewrite the file, I've already tried to do it in other ways but when I mentioned a modification for for Kerbin I get an error and I've tried everything but I'm still trying if someone knows how to do it would be a great help!

Replacing System.cfg is an absolute no-no and makes uninstalling your mod nearly impossible, or really hard at last. The users would have to reinstall Kopernicus completely, which might be difficult (especially when you are using CKAN).

Thats why every planet pack that exists uses ModuleManager to modify the system. It's changes are not persistent and can be mixed with other packs or modifications.

 

Also, RSS should already be compatible with the 1.4.* builds of Kopernicus, since the config layout didn't change since 1.3.1-7 (the version that is linked in the OP).

So it might be easier to just submit your patches back to the RSS upstream instead of releasing your own fork.

Hello @Thomas P. If you try to install the Kopernicus RSS files in the current versions I will give you errors at this moment I am finding out how to add it without replacing anything, thanks for your support GREETINGS!
So, you hijacked the mod and posted it in the original mod-maker's topic?

@XxLedvin25xX I am sure your work is appreciated, but did you check back with the guys who started this topic/mod revival before you posted your modifications? If not, it might be seen as bad etiquette to hijack a mods thread like this.

Be advised to check back with the original re-creators of the mod before you add your own fork into their thread.

No offence, just a friendly heads-up. All modding efforts are welcome here, I am sure, but there are certain unwritten rules that we need to learn and follow.

 

cheers

Daf

4 hours ago, XxLedvin25xX said:

Hi! I just try to help the community making small modifications that make it work in 1.4 but if someone feels offended or see how bad I report and I will remove the mod, greetings!

 You should never, ever replace a file in another mod. If you can't get module manager to change it for you then ask for help because that's the right way to do it. By replacing the file, you make it impossible for anyone to do anything beyond creating a total new install if they need  to update, or any other changes, etc

You also removed the RSS assembly, required for some basic background tasks. Any reason why did not do a proper recompile?
